The document contains a summary of assessment criteria for glazing.
The criteria include product information, thermal insulation performance, shading coefficient, and visible light transmittance.
The product information should be provided on the packaging of the product and/or company website.
The product information should include instructions on installation, adjustment, and protection of the product.
The product information should include U-value, solar heat gain coefficient, and visible light transmittance.
The product information should include recommended maintenance for the product.
The product information should include details related to the end of service life of the product.
Documentation related to the label and relevant information should be provided.
Verification of the product information is required.
Points are awarded for the product information.
The thermal insulation performance of the product should meet certain requirements.
Laboratory test report(s) on the U-value of the entire glazing product are required.
Points are awarded for the thermal insulation performance.
The shading coefficient of the product should meet certain requirements.
Laboratory test report(s) on shading coefficient or solar heat gain coefficient are required.
Points are awarded for the shading coefficient.
The visible light transmittance of the product should meet certain requirements.
Laboratory test report(s) on daylight transmittance are required.
Points are awarded for the visible light transmittance.
The Construction Industry Council publishes the Assessment Standard for GLAZING (Version 1.0a).
The document is copyrighted by the Construction Industry Council in 2020.
The document states that the English version shall prevail in case of inconsistency or ambiguity between the English and Chinese versions.
The document outlines the Summary of Assessment Criteria for GLAZING.
The document specifies the Core Criteria for GLAZING.
The document requires product information to be provided on the packaging of the product and/or company website.
The document requires laboratory test reports for thermal insulation performance.
The document requires laboratory test reports for shading coefficient.
The document requires laboratory test reports for visible light transmittance.

HKGBC Green Product Accreditation and Standards [HK G-PASS]
The Scheme is owned by the Construction Industry Council (CIC) and implemented by the Hong Kong Green Building Council (HKGBC).
It aims to help consumers, building professionals and policy makers identify environmentally preferable building materials and products.
The Standard sets out the assessment criteria and their benchmarks for glazing products.
It governs the application and award of a label under the Scheme.
The Standard defines the verification methods to determine which labelling grade should be awarded to the product.
The Standard neither modifies nor supersedes laws and regulations.
Compliance with this Standard is not a substitute for, and does not assure, compliance with any applicable laws or regulations.
Compliance with all applicable laws and regulations is a prerequisite for the manufacturing and marketing of the product.
The glazing area of a building could account for 10 to 25% of a building's exposed surface.
The greatest environmental impact of glazing products is resulted from the energy losses during the building operation stage.
The purposes of the assessment criteria developed for glazing are, therefore, to promote the use of energy-efficient building envelop, and to minimise the environmental impact.
Many of the glazing products contain substances that may be harmful to the environment and human health.
The scope of this Standard is applicable to glass in fixed and opening windows, window doors, and other elements of building envelop.
Glass blocks and bricks or glass used for internal partitions are excluded from this Standard.
The Scheme is owned by the Construction Industry Council (CIC) and implemented by the Hong Kong Green Building Council (HKGBC)
The Standard sets out the assessment criteria and their benchmarks for glazing products
The Standard defines the verification methods to determine which labelling grade should be awarded to the product
Compliance with this Standard is not a substitute for, and does not assure, compliance with any applicable laws or regulations
Compliance with all applicable laws and regulations is a prerequisite for the manufacturing and marketing of the product
Glazing products are commonly used for fixed and opening windows, window doors, curtain walls and other elements of the building envelop
The glazing area of a building could account for 10 to 25% of a building's exposed surface
The glazing area of a building serves as an interface to transmit light and provide outdoor view
Common types of glazing being used in architectural applications include clear and tinted float glass, tempered glass, and laminated glass as well as a variety of coated glasses, etc
Many of the glazing products contain substances that may be harmful to the environment and human health
The greatest environmental impact of glazing products is resulted from the energy losses during the building operation stage due to their long technical service life

The purposes of the assessment criteria developed for glazing are to promote the use of energy-efficient building envelop, and to minimise the environmental impact through stringent assessment criteria on the production process and use of materials
The scope of this Standard is applicable to glass in fixed and opening windows, window doors, and other elements of building envelop
Glass blocks and bricks or glass used for internal partitions are excluded from this Standard
Each application should specify its types and product series
Subsequent applications can be made for similar products with different thickness and/or coatings under a labelled product series
A product to be assessed should meet all the minimum requirements of the Core Criteria
be awarded a Green Label under the Scheme
Bonus points may be awarded if the product meets the Non-core Criteria
a Bronze, Silver, Gold or Platinum Label will be awarded according to the total points accumulated
All submissions and documentations shall be endorsed by the Chief Executive Officer or other authorised personnel
The Construction Industry Council established the CIC Green Product Certification Scheme.
China National Accreditation Service for Conformity Assessment is involved in the certification process.
China National Accreditation Service for Conformity Assessment
Windows with two or three layers of glass are considered suitable for energy efficiency.
External reflectance is a factor in daylight reflection from building surfaces.
The Hong Kong Green Building Council Limited is involved in the evaluation process.
The Hong Kong Accreditation Service is involved in the accreditation process.
The Hong Kong Laboratory Accreditation Scheme is involved in the laboratory testing process.
Material Safety Data Sheets must be up-to-date to qualify as suitable.
The International Agency for Research on Cancer provides information on product safety.
The International Organisation for Standardisation provides standards for product evaluation.
Third-party entities are involved in the evaluation process.
U-values are calculated to determine heat transfer through glazing products.
Visible light transmittance is a factor in product evaluation.
Products must meet the "Core Criteria" to be awarded a "Green" Label.
Bonus points may be awarded for meeting "Non-core Criteria".
Labels are awarded based on total points accumulated.
Submissions and documentations are endorsed by the Chief Executive Officer or other authorised personnel.
All certification, laboratory report and documentation must be valid during the assessment process and labelling period.
The validity of all laboratory report and documentation shall be 5 years from the date of issue.
The chemical tests should be conducted by either a third party or the manufacturer who has received the ISO17025 certification or relevant national accreditation systems.
The chemical tests should be conducted by either a third party or the manufacturer who has received the ISO17025 certification or relevant national accreditation systems, e.g. HOKLAS, CNAS, etc.

The product shall fulfil the quality, safety, air leakage and other functional requirements according to the British Standards (BS), BS EN (European Standard), American Society for Testing and Materials (ASTM), Chinese National Standard (GB) or equivalent national standards.
In addition, glass manufacturer shall provide a 10-year guarantee covering functions and quality according to relevant standards.

Manufacturer of the products shall possess valid certificates of ISO14001 or the EU Eco-Management and Audit Scheme (EMAS).

Targets shall be set to reduce the environmental impacts during the manufacturing process which include but not limited to the reduction of hazardous substance emissions, energy consumption, CO<sup>2</sup> emissions, secondary environmental load, waste management, water management, etc.

Targets shall be set to reduce the environmental impacts during the manufacturing process which include but not limited to the reduction of hazardous substance emissions, energy consumption, CO2 emissions, secondary environmental load, waste management, water management, etc.
The following essential information shall be provided by the product manufacturer with each delivery of the glazing products or made available to the public.
Instructions on how the product shall be installed, adjusted and protected in a sustainable manner, in order to prevent heat loss as a result of poor installation.
Information on the product's U-value, solar heat gain coefficient (SHGC) and visible light transmittance (VLT).
Instructions describing the recommended maintenance for the product.
Care instructions should contain details on how often the product should be checked and maintained, and what surface treatment is recommended.
Details of what should be done with the product at the end of its life cycle.

The packaging materials shall be comprised of 100% recycled material or be readily recyclable, decomposable, or contain no coatings, impregnated chemicals or other materials that would prevent recycling or decomposition.
The packaging materials shall: - o Not contain halogenated plastics,

The packaging materials shall: - o Be comprised of 100% recycled material or be readily recyclable, decomposable, or contain no coatings, impregnated chemicals or other materials that would prevent recycling or decomposition.
Verification Documentation describing the packaging materials used as well as their chemical composition (if any and where applicable), treatment process and recyclability should be submitted.
Manufacturers have been investigating and adopting innovative technologies to enhance the durability and environmental performance of the glazing products.

Durability and environmental performance of glazing products is advocated in the glazing industry due to the increasing awareness of "green products" among the contractors, architects and end-users, etc.
For example, high durability of glazing products can reduce resource consumption.
The technology adopted in the glazing manufacturing that can enable the glazing products to reduce resources used in: - o Maintenance, e.g. self-cleaning glass, etc.
High durability of glazing products can reduce resource consumption.

The technology adopted in the glazing manufacturing that can enable the glazing products to reduce resources used in: - o Energy, such as lighting, e.g. instantly reactive glazing technology that changes the glass from clear to a dark blue tint, self-tinted glass, etc.
The overall heat transfer coefficient or U-value measures how well a glazing product transfer heat.
A low U-value indicates the glazing product is well insulated, resulting in a reduction of cooling load.
In this Standard, the U-value of the single, double or tripled glazing products shall meet the requirements.
Verification Documentation related to the above product information and instructions, web pages and any other information freely available to customers or the public.

The packaging materials shall: - Not contain halogenated plastics, and - Be comprised of 100% recycled material or be readily recyclable, decomposable, or contain no coatings, impregnated chemicals or other materials that would prevent recycling or decomposition.

The technology adopted in the glazing manufacturing that can enable the glazing products to reduce resources used in: - o Maintenance, e.g. self-cleaning glass, etc. Or - o Energy, such as lighting, e.g. instantly reactive glazing technology that changes the glass from clear to a dark blue tint, self-tinted glass, etc.
Verification Documentation describing the extra environmental features adopted as well as the product functions generated by the technology.
The U-value of the product should be measured according to the applicable ISO 8990 or EN-ISO 12567 standard.
Alternatively, the U-value can be calculated according to the standard EN673 (Glazing) and EN ISO 10077 (Frame / Casement).

The external reflectance of glazing product shall be less than 20%.

The SHGC and VLT should be measured in accordance with the EN 410 or ISO 9050 standard.
